Job.Title: Travel Consultant
Job.Summary: A great opportunity in a growing team for you to utilise your strong travel industry knowledge and apply this using your outstanding customer service.
Job.Description:
HRG Australia, part of a Hogg Robinson Group (HRG) is an award winning corporate travel services company providing a range of business travel related products and services. Totally committed to a value offering, our extensive and comprehensive portfolio includes: travel management and fulfilment services; low cost transactions; consultancy services; sports; expense management and processing; conferences, meetings and events management.

Our company is built on CHOICE values. It is these values that shape everything we do. For our people, CHOICE means opportunities to develop new skills, to accept new challenges and to broaden horizons through ongoing initiatives and development programs. 

 

We are seeking experienced domestic and international travel consultants with a strong customer service focus to join our Canberra team.  In this role you will deal with high end government clients on a daily basis and will be involved in all aspects of travel arrangements including booking flights, accommodation, transfers, etc.

 

If you would like to be part of a leading Global Corporate Travel Company and want to receive longevity in your career, this may be the role you have been looking for.

 

What you will do:

  • Provide advice on all travel related matters including airfares, accommodation, transfers, travel insurance and other travel related matters
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with all clients
  • Work within client SLA and maintain high levels of service standards and consulting skills by offering dedicated customer service
  • Ensure client policy is adhered to at all times
  • Offer the most appropriate fares and routings with alternatives when applicable
  • Issue all relevant documentation for clients travel arrangements including itineraries, vouchers and other documents as required
  • Initiate action to prevent the occurrence and/or reoccurrence of problems

What you will have:

  • Strong skills in fares and ticketing
  • Previous experience within the travel industry
  • Experience using a Central Reservations System (Galileo Viewpoint preferred)
  • High attention to detail
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • Outstanding customer service
  • Excellent time management

What's in it for you...

 

We will offer a friendly working environment, career and development opportunities, online learning and training programs, continuous support and a central location close to public transport.

 

If you believe you have what it takes and are a positive and proactive person with a strong customer service focus, take pride and ownership in your contribution and want to be part of a growing organisation, please forward your CV and covering letter via the link below. 

 

Applications close on Monday 12 August 2013.

Please note: To be eligible for employment with HRG Australia you will be required to undergo an Australian National Criminal History Clearance and hold the right to work in Australia.

 

All personal information provided in job applications will be held in accordance with HRG's Privacy Policy.

Job.Title: National Administration Support Coordinator
Job.Summary: Do you have experience within the Travel Industry and are looking for a back office role?
Job.Description:
HRG Australia, part of a Hogg Robinson Group (HRG) is an award winning corporate travel services company providing a range of business travel related products and services. Totally committed to a value offering, our extensive and comprehensive portfolio includes: travel management and fulfilment services; low cost transactions; consultancy services; sports; expense management and processing; conferences, meetings and events management.
  
Our company is built on CHOICE values. It is these values that shape everything we do. For our people, CHOICE means opportunities to develop new skills, to accept new challenges and to broaden horizons through ongoing initiatives and development programs.  
  
We have an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join our fast-paced National Administration Team located in our newly refurbished Sydney CBD office.
  
As a member of the National Administration Support team, you will provide support and assistance to the national HRG network by fulfilling all centralised business functions including refunds, ADMs, BSP reconciliation, invoicing and hotel chargebacks.  
  
You will also be a part of and act as HRGs proactive solutions team offering expert advice and guidance whilst effectively bridging the gap between key areas of the business such as Client Management, Finance and Operations.
  
What you will do: 

  • Complete all international and domestic refunds
  • Investigate and manage all national ADMs always aiming to deliver the best results for HRG
  • Working closely with Finance to assist in BSP and low cost carrier reconciliation  
  • Fulfilment of all invoicing needs for HRG nationally, including ongoing support for the all in-house invoicing robotics and the provision of all client invoices (client facing) 
  • Responsible for the end to end hotel and car hire charge back process including the distribution of hotel charge back vouchers and associated reconciliation 
  • Preparation and distribution of all client unused e-ticket credit reports      
  • Handling all credit card rejections in a timely and professional manner 
What you will have:
  • Working knowledge of Galileo and BSP 
  • Ability to maintain a high level of attention to detail at all times
  • Possession of good interpersonal skills. The ability to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team       
  • Experience in refunds, ADMs, BSP reconciliation and invoicing would be advantageous      
  • Excellent phone and face to face communication skills possessing a tolerant and patient manner 
  • Ability to work within strict SLAs and maintain a lateral thinking approach.

Why join us?

We can offer a friendly working environment; career and development opportunities; online learning and training program; continuous support and a central location to public transport, shops and award winning cafes.
   
If you believe you have what it takes, please forward your CV and covering letter via the link below.

 

Applications close Thursday 29 August 2013.
